text: Modifies the time of Packed Disk Sequences, Alembic sequences, or sequences created via the s@instancefile attribute.

This node can modify the frame index and the cycling mode of most packed file sequences.
It does this by modifying the
intrinsic of Packed Disk Sequences, or the
attribute associated with delayed load file sequences (such as the Redshift Packed Proxy SOP).

-based sequences do not automatically have cycling behavior. If you create your Alembic instances using the MOPs Instancer, this behavior will be added for you. Otherwise, you will need to enable Set Cycling Mode and Override Frame Range to tell Set Sequence Time how to handle the frame range.

Packed Alembics and Packed Disk Sequences don’t always reliably show you the correct sequence index in the viewport. If you want to check to verify the sequence indexes are being set correctly, you’ll need to either render or unpack. Sequences using the
attribute will not show correctly in the viewport. The objects should always render correctly regardless of what the viewport tells you!
Plug in Packed Disk Sequences, Packed Alembics, or points with the
The method by which you want to modify the time of each sequence. Expression mode uses a simple expression to determine the timing for each sequence. Attribute mode uses a point attribute value.
The frame you want the sequences to use, or an amount to add to the frame (or other operations, depending on the Mode parameter). Frames can be fractional if the sequence’s point count is consistent.
A float-type point attribute that determines the frame you want each sequence to use (or add, etc. depending on the Mode parameter).
The method by which you want to adjust the timing for each sequence with the given Frame Index or attribute (depending on the Mode parameter).
If you're using this node to set the
attribute, this is the separator used to denote the frame extension. This node assumes that the file extension is always a dot.
If the File Path Separator is set to Custom Regex, this is the regular expression used to detect the frame extension for the
attribute. This setting is for advanced users that need to support more unusual file patterns for frame sequences.
Enable to set the cycling mode of the sequence using the Cycling Mode control.
Choose how the sequence cycles. The options are
Clamp: The sequence only plays between its defined start and end frames, then holds still.
Mirror: The sequence ping-pongs between the start and end frames.
Strict: The sequence plays once. If any objects are outside their start and end frames, they will be deleted.
On anything other than Packed Disk Sequences, this creates or modifies the s@mops_seq_wrap attribute.
Choose a new frame range. This does not apply to Packed Disk Sequences. This creates or modifies the f@mops_seq_start and f@mops_seq_end attributes.

title: MOPs Set Sequence Time
summary: Modifies the time of Packed Disk Sequences, Alembic sequences, or sequences created via the s@instancefile attribute.
